main event: On September 12, 1951, in Cincinnati, Ohio, a dark-red glow with a white trail was observed at high speed, resembling the shape of a bullet. The object was about the size of a B-29 and disappeared behind mountains to the north in 10 seconds. The conclusion was that it was evaluated as a meteor.
interesting points: The observation lasted for only 10 seconds, indicating a brief but memorable sighting.
The report describes the object as a dark-red glow with a white trail, resembling the shape of a bullet, and about the size of a B-29.
The lack of investigation suggests a possible dismissal of the sighting as a common occurrence.
The report classifies the observed object as a meteor despite its unusual characteristics.
The air intelligence information report from Project Blue Book indicates that the witness was a single individual with an unknown background.
sighted object: dark-red glow with a white trail
